Description: An Agile Program Lead is responsible for overseeing the execution of large-scale, complex projects that involve multiple Agile teams. The role involves managing the end-to-end delivery of programs, from strategy development and planning to execution and delivery.

Required.SkillDescription: Deep understanding of Agile methodologies, and the ability to lead and guide teams in implementing and optimizing these practices at the program level
Expertise in program management principles and practices, and the ability to manage large-scale Agile programs
Expertise in SAFe framework and the ability to lead and guide teams in implementing and optimizing SAFe practices at the program level
Ability to manage stakeholder expectations and relationships, and to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to manage and lead Agile teams at the program level, and to coordinate team efforts across multiple departments and business units

Recommended.SkillDescription: Understanding of Kanban methodology and experience in implementing and optimizing Kanban practices for software development and other areas at the program level
Understanding of Lean principles, and the ability to guide organizations in implementing and optimizing Lean practices at the program level
Understanding of Agile scaling frameworks such as Scrum@Scale, Nexus, and Spotify Model, and the ability to guide organizations in implementing and optimizing these frameworks at the program level
Ability to identify and manage risks and issues at the program level, and to develop risk mitigation strategies that minimize program risks
Ability to drive continuous improvement for Agile practices and tools at the program level, and to identify opportunities for optimization and efficiency gains
Strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization at the program level
Strong facilitation skills, and the ability to lead meetings and workshops that promote effective communication and collaboration at the program level
Ability to design and deliver effective Agile training and development programs for individuals and teams at the program level
Strong understanding of the business context in which Agile practices are implemented at the program level, and the ability to align Agile practices with the goals and objectives of the organization
Ability to develop and execute strategic plans for Agile transformation and implementation at the program level, and to align these plans with the goals and objectives of the organization
Ability to provide leadership and mentorship to individuals and teams, and to create a culture of innovation and continuous improvement at the program level
Ability to foster a culture of innovation and creativity within teams, and to promote the development of new and innovative solutions at the program level
Ability to facilitate effective collaboration among individuals and teams, and to promote a culture of knowledge sharing and cross-functional teamwork at the program level
Ability to manage program budgets, and to develop and implement financial plans that maximize the value of the program while minimizing costs
